Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2008 06:27PM kimmiecakes57 wrote: dear susan, my sister had thyroid cancer last spring.  she had 7 nodules on the outside of her thyroid...she has had thyroid problems for 10-15 years...she had several needle biopsies and they came back atypical.  she opted to have her thyroid removed and when they did the pathology, they discovered she had cancer.  they never would have known that if she hadn't insisted on having the entire gland removed.  her treatment was to take a radioactive pill and be in complete seclusion for 2 days in the hospital (which she kinda liked...a busy mom of three).  she has had no problems since.  you need to listen to your gut and do what you feel is right.  you are right in stating that thyroid cancer is very very curable.  best of luck with everything, kim
